alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 3:22PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a small area of slow moving thunderstorms impacting parts of North Charleston near the interchange with Interstates 26 and 526. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen within the last hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Goose Creek, Hanahan, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Daniel Island, Downtown Charleston, West Ashley, Don Holt Bridge, Charleston Naval Complex, Charleston Airport, Magnolia Gardens, Park Circle, Riverfront Park, Midland Park, Westmoreland Bridge, Red Bank Landing, Beresford and Lambs.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
